content:
Introduction

Web 3 is at boom right now, making projects during a hackathon is a great way to sharpen your skills, learn new technologies, and win rewards.

I've highlighted a few that you might be interested in.

There's no need to be concerned about your age because the majority of people are of any age.

1. Welcome to the Solana Riptide Hackathon

  • Ends: 17 Mar, 2022
  • Venue: Online
  • Theme: Blockchain
  • Total Prize worth: $5 Million + More

Who can participate:

  • Anyone
  • All countries
  • Team size - 2-4 members

Register Here: Link

2. Theta Q1 2022 Hackathon

  • Ends: 23 Apr, 2022
  • Venue: Online
  • Theme: AR/VR, Blockchain, Gaming
  • Total Prize worth: $500,000

Who can participate:

  • Anyone who is 18+
  • All countries
  • Team size - 1-4 members

Register Here: Link

3. Faber Web3 Hackathon

  • Ends: 18 Mar, 2022
  • Venue: Online
  • Theme: Blockchain, Beginner Friendly, Web
  • Total Prize worth: €75,000

Who can participate:

  • Anyone who is 18+
  • All countries
  • Team size - 1-4 members

Register Here: Link

4. Arweave <> Polygon Hackathon

  • Ends: 11 Mar, 2022
  • Venue: Online
  • Theme: Blockchain, Web
  • Total Prize worth: $15,000

Who can participate:

  • Anyone
  • All countries
  • Team size - 1-4 members

Register Here: Link

5.Meter Ethereum Hackathon

  • Ends: 11 Apr, 2022
  • Venue: Online
  • Theme: Blockchain
  • Total Prize worth: $100,000

Who can participate:

  • Anyone
  • All countries
  • Team size - 2-4 members

Register Here: Link

Bonus

1. YPStem Hackathon 2022

  • Ends: 7 Mar, 2022
  • Venue: Online
  • Theme: Low/No Code, Beginner Friendly, Open Ended
  • Total Prize worth: $50,000

Who can participate:

  • Anyone who is 13+
  • All countries
  • Team size - 1-4 members

Register Here: Link

2. Microsoft US Azure AI: Hack for Humanitarian Action

  • Ends: 28 Mar, 2022
  • Venue: Online
  • Theme: Health, Lifehacks, Social Good
  • Total Prize worth: $10,000

Who can participate:

  • Anyone
  • US Only
  • Team size - 1-4 members

Register Here: Link

Points to be noted

  • Open-Ended means you can build whatever you want and can use any technology you are familiar with, example webdev, AI/ML etc.
  • Some hackathons allow cross submission, which means you can submit the same project at multiple hackathons.
  • Also, be active in the discord/slack of the particular hackathon you are attending as there are various mini-events, raffles etc. are also organized which you can take part in.

Thank you for reading this, article. I hope you enjoy participating in this amazing hackathons and learn something.

I would really appreciate you if you would follow me on Twitter.
title: Web3 Hackathons you can attend
author: Mert Düzgün
